title: Martin Keown tears into "inept" Man Utd and says Fred is "becoming a joke"
text:

Martin Keown has delivered a scathing assessment of Manchester United following Sunday's defeat by Newcastle, adding midfielder Fred is "becoming a joke".

The Red Devils were looking to get back to winning ways against the Magpies at St James' Park but were beaten 1-0 in a particularly poor game.

Keown hit out at Manchester United's inability to keep possession, adding that they have no creativity in the middle of the park.

The former Arsenal centre-back also claimed that it looks as if it is the beginning of the end for Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, who is struggling to turns things around at Old Trafford.

(Image: BBC)

"They're so inept in possession. Fred, it's almost becoming a joke when he gets the ball. I know it's good closing down but you've got to be able to control it and pass," said Keown on Match of the Day.

"If that's the central midfield then there's not going to be anything created.

"They started playing balls long into [Marcus] Rashford and I feel sorry for him because he's surviving on scraps. But he should do better.

"Look at his body language… I think he's starting to despair with what's around him."

(Image: Getty Images)

He added: "You start to look at where the system is… where's the intensity? I think the belief is ebbing away and this could be the beginning of the end for this manager.

"I don't want to see a former player come in and leave the job but there has to be a spark, there has to be a reaction and it seems to just be spiraling out of control. This is a really poor result."
description: Manchester United were beaten 1-0 by Newcastle on Sunday and Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is under increasing pressure
